• GRACE AND COURTESY WITH YOUR BIGS • 

Like 🫶 and comment MANNERS and I’ll send the link to your DMs 🔗 

As my two bigs are getting bigger, I’m finding a lot of new situations popping up where some explicit explanations/practise are helpful for them to understand more complex situations and contexts. Situations which require ‘manners’ or ‘courtesy’ in particular, for example manners around being served food that they don’t like, or introducing yourself to new friends, or not staring when they seem someone who looks different from themselves. 

This flipbook was recommended to me by a friend and it’s now become our dinnertime conversation starter. I flip through it if there’s anything in particular I’m feeling we need to cover, and it provokes great discussions without being directed at any particular child, meaning we cover these topics from a joint place of curiosity rather than from a place of critique. 

It gives a short, sharp, easy to understand explanations that make tricky topics easy to talk about and easy for kids to understand, and has been a really valuable tool to have in our home to help cover grace and courtesy with our young children!
